caption: Beautiful bridge that leads to the Eiffel Tower and crosses the Seine River. Amazing photo spot for great pictures of the Eiffel Tower. The Olympic sign is also located on this bridge. We loved our visit and the great photos we took of the Eiffel Tower.

Just one of the many bridges that cross the Seine but this one is diectly in line with the Eiffel Tower. It has statues at each corner and they depict muscular men with horses in the classical Roman style.
During our visit the bridge was closed to traffic, which was awesome, however, it was absolutely packed with visitors, also not a bad view of the tower from here.
I guess everyone's gonna cross Pont d'I√©na from Trocadero towards the Eiffel Tower. The views aren't as good from Trocadero though.
A bridge that goes over the river Seine and leads to the Eiffel Tower.Below it you can go on a boat ride thru Paris!

I think this bridge namely Pont d'Iena has one of the best view of Seine. It is always busy with visitors because it is right in front of Eiffel tower. It connects both sides of Paris, has beautiful sculptures.

Picture a picturesque bridge strategically nestled between the iconic Eiffel Tower and the Trocad√©ro in Paris. This bridge serves as a prime spot for photography, especially in the spring when the weather is clear and sunny. The surrounding scenery is vividly green, adding a lush backdrop to the stunning architectural views of both the Eiffel Tower and the Trocad√©ro. During this season, the atmosphere is vibrant, and the air is fresh, making it an idyllic time for visitors and locals alike to capture memorable photos. The bridge offers a unique vantage point where the grandeur of these famous landmarks can be appreciated in full, surrounded by the natural beauty of springtime in Paris. It is also remarkably convenient to reach. A nearby metro station is just a short walk away, making this location exceptionally accessible for everyone. Whether you're a local out for a leisurely stroll or a tourist hopping from one site to another, this bridge offers a hassle-free visit. The combination of stunning views, the fresh, vibrant spring setting, and easy metro access makes it a favorite spot for capturing the essence of Paris in the spring.

The bridge is always busy but understandably so as an icon for the city!  Great spot for pictures and views on either side of the bridge. There are a lot of people bustling on the bridge so an excellent spot for pickpockets. Caution is strongly advised to protect your purses and pockets!  Good spot to get souvenirs, although there will be a slight premium due to location. Prices are similar to Champs-Elysees.

At night the Eiffel Tower is even more sublime and majestic.  When the illumination switches to dark and stays that way for minutes, the murmuring among the tourists becomes more intense.  On the Pont d'lena, the souvenirs sellers are in the majority, which is annoying.
At night is the best to go at and enjoy the view from the river. It was magical.

A bridge for photoing the Eiffel tower, the best spot to take them of the bridge is always captured by some horrible people and making photos for high fee, which is quite annoyed, but this place is definitely a good spot .
Good spot for photos and spend some quality time near to river

Best view of Eiffel tower. Nice place to rest in calm and cool whether. Fountains nearby can give you extra coolness during summer. You can spend even whole day at thia place. If you have child, they can play in an adjacent park.
Nice place to take beautiful pictures of eiffel Tower. The angle with the seine river would give you awesome pictures. Specially at night time the view would be absolutely breathtaking.

Bridge on the Seine The Jena Bridge, 140 meters long and 35 meters wide, was built between the years 1808 AD to 1814 AD by the engineer Lamandi, and it is the first bridge that was achieved after Napoleon's victory in Jena. In 1806 AD, it consists of five arches, each 28 meters long. meters. It is made of stones. Today, the bridge is an important tourist attraction for the city, as it offers stunning views of the city and its surroundings, the Seine River, and the adjacent Eiffel Tower.
Personally, the Eiffel Tower is beautiful to see from the outside. It is better to shoot from Iena Bridge.
Amazing experience in this place. I had the best photos and people were very kind.

This bridge offers an unobstructed view of the Eiffel Tower it's also a beautiful bridge over the Seine River where you can just sit and watch boats and people. There are restaurants close by, and lots of shops on the southside of this bridge. The views at night are stunning. This is a must-see area while in Paris.
Amazing place to take your picture of the Eiffel Tower.  Can ben crowded on this bridge.

**Pont d'I√©na: A Timeless Marvel**  The Pont d'I√©na stands as a majestic testament to Parisian engineering and history. Spanning the Seine River with graceful arches and intricate details, this iconic bridge offers a breathtaking panorama of the Eiffel Tower and the surrounding cityscape.  Walking across the Pont d'I√©na is a journey through time, where one can feel the echoes of Parisian life from centuries past. The views from the bridge are simply unparalleled, providing a perfect vantage point for capturing the beauty of the Eiffel Tower against the backdrop of the Seine.  Whether strolling hand in hand with a loved one, capturing the perfect photograph, or simply admiring the architectural grandeur, the Pont d'I√©na offers an experience that is both unforgettable and quintessentially Parisian. A visit to this historic bridge is a must for anyone seeking to immerse themselves in the charm and allure of the City of Light.
You have to do it at night. Watch for pick pockets but be there on the hour to watch the tower sparkle. Great for people watching.
Great landmark and great for photos of the Eiffel Tower
Very good place to take a pictures of Eiffel Tower.
Great place to room around and take pictures of the Eiffel tower!! Bridge area is so beautiful!!

This bridge is really beautiful. If you want a great view of the Eiffel Tower with this bridge in the background and fewer people around, take a walk here until you find your favorite spot. Once you've found it, set up your tripod for some fantastic photos.
23/11  You can clearly see the Eiffel Tower!
